Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பகையகத்துப் பேடிகை ஒள்வாள் அவையகத்து அஞ்சு மவன்கற்ற நூல்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The learning of him who is diffident before an assembly is like the shining sword of an hermaphrodite in the presence of his foes.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A direct and powerful visual analogy. On the left, in a fierce battlefield ('பகையகத்து'), an effeminate or cowardly person ('பேடி') holds a sharp, shining sword ('ஒள்வாள்'), but is trembling and unable to use it effectively against an enemy.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, in a learned assembly ('அவையகத்து'), a scholar who is terrified of the audience ('அஞ்சுமவன்') holds a great book of knowledge ('கற்ற நூல்'). Like the coward with the sword, he is trembling and unable to use his knowledge effectively.
Layered_Composition.Background: In both cases, the powerful tool—the sword and the book—is rendered completely useless and pathetic by the fear of the person holding it.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The knowledge of a scholar who fears the assembly is as useless as a sharp sword in the hands of a coward on the battlefield.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The parallel between the two scenes is the entire message. The shining sword and the great book are both potent symbols of power, made impotent by fear.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: Harsh, judgmental lighting on both figures, highlighting their fear and failure. The sword and book can gleam ironically.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A side-by-side composition that makes the comparison stark and unavoidable.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, focusing on the fearful expressions and the unused potential of the tools.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Historical realism, with a strong allegorical message.
